title: 103_hr2766
content: The authority to impose secondary market fees is granted in Section 1. The Small Business Act is amended to allow the Administration to collect fees for loan guarantees sold in the secondary market. The fees include up to 0.4% per year on the outstanding balance of the guaranteed loan and up to 50% of the sale price exceeding 110% of the outstanding principal amount. These fees are collected by the agent handling central registration functions and are used to reduce the subsidy on guaranteed loans under section 7(a) of the Act. The Small Business Act allows the Administration to collect fees for loan guarantees in the secondary market. New fees imposed by the Administration will only apply to loans sold after August 31, 1993. SEC. 2. AUTHORITY TO REDUCE LOAN GUARANTEE PERCENTAGES. Section 7(a)(2) of the Small Business Act is amended to require not less than 75 percent financing for amounts over $155,000 with a maturity of over 10 years, and not less than 85 percent financing for other amounts. The Small Business Act is amended to require a minimum of 75 percent financing for amounts over $155,000 with a maturity of over 10 years. The participation by the Administration may be reduced below 85 percent upon request of the lender. The specified percentums are adjusted accordingly. The Small Business Act is amended to set a maximum interest rate for loans guaranteed under the Preferred Lenders Program. The amendments will be effective from September 1, 1993, but not applicable to loan guarantee applications received before August 21, 1993. The Small Business Act is amended to set a maximum interest rate for loans guaranteed under the Preferred Lenders Program. Effective from September 1, 1993, but not applicable to loan guarantee applications received before August 21, 1993. SEC. 3. STUDY AND REPORT. The Administration will study and evaluate the impact of amendments on small businesses, minorities, and women's ability to obtain financing. Reports will be submitted to the Committees on Small Business annually. The Administration will study the impact of amendments on small businesses, minorities, and women's financing. Findings will be segregated by ethnic and gender components. "Small business concerns owned and controlled by minorities" includes designated groups listed in the Small Business Act. SEC. 4. REPEALER. Sections 1 and 2 of this Act will be repealed on September 30, 1996.
